messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] patchwork
messages.messageBody:
**<< Don't you think she is talking about quilts? >>

She said they don't keep anyone warm.**

Oh, I may have expressed it badly, and I was being strange in my
description.

I was talking about piecing quilts. I don't often get past that step
and make a finished quilt. And I make small ones. (In theory because
I can finish them faster, maybe before I lose interest.)

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] patchwork
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/29/02 12:20:29 AM, Dnowens@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/29/02 12:20:29 AM, Dnowens@... writes:

<< Don't you think she is talking about quilts? >>

She said they don't keep anyone warm.

Maybe wall quilts or pillows!

> to keep anyone warm at night.

> Betsy

messages.subject: patchwork
messages.msgSnippet: OH.. i love clothing made out of cloth that is pieces of other fabric all sewn together like that.. do you make anything with them? Linda LL ... From: Betsy
messages.messageBody:
OH.. i love clothing made out of cloth that is pieces of other fabric all sewn together like that.. do you make anything with them?
Linda LL
----- Original Message -----
From: Betsy
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, June 28, 2002 10:38 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] video games, role play games

One of my favorite hobbies is cutting perfectly good fabric into little
pieces and then sewing it back together again in geometric patterns. It
sounds pretty silly when I describe it like that. And I'm not doing it
to keep anyone warm at night.

Betsy
